THE FRANK A. MUNSEY COMPANY
175 FIFTH AVENUE, NEW YORK

div1.p: The tomahawk is buried, but in my bosom. You have thrown it from afar, and it has cleft me. The haft sticks out on one side and the head out of the other. You throw the weapon with a strong arm.

It shows, among other things, that you will fight back, that you are prepared to get right down on the bunch grass and fight it out with all the weapons at hand, and you've got my scalp hanging at your belt and my wampum around your neck.

Be merciful, oh conqueror, and let me sleep outside the tent and guard its flap against the wolves that later will call on you. No aboriginal man can keep them off, but he can conquer them. Witness my whining by the river. You have kicked me, and I lick your boot. You have pulled out sufficient fur from my coat to give me chilblains and make me plead for warmth. I am howling for a stroke of your hand.

I would not take a thousand dollars for your reply to the "Mignon" criticism. It was the snort of the enraged buffalo, pawing the turf and bellowing defiance. Don't worry about my throwing any more lariats over you. I got my hand between the rope and the pommel and it is well skinned. Let's go over and have a drink somewhere, and cut it out. No man should have a lady like Mignon on his staff without defending her.

I am enclosing your letter to Streamer as I read him my letter to you, and it would be unfair to with-holdwithhold the former after having
-7- 13
John G. Neihardt, Esq., ------------2.
displayed the latter. I am also enclosing your letter about the poem, which shall be printed according to your instructions. And, in order to show Streamer that you are a man of the deepest feeling and the finest sentiment, I am enclosing your hastily penned note, showing that, having trod upon the worm, your heart is filled with compassion.
Believe me unterrified and with the wound already healed.
